questions.prompt: 1. In BG 11.1, what does Arjuna ask Krishna to reveal?
questions.feedback: Arjuna requests Krishna to show His divine cosmic form to behold His glory.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 11.7-8, what does Krishna grant to Arjuna?
choices: Celestial vision to see His cosmic form
questions.feedback: Krishna grants Arjuna divine eyes to perceive His transcendental universal form.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 11.9-31, what are some characteristics of Krishna's cosmic form?
choices: All the infinite universes within it; infinite faces, arms, and eyes
questions.feedback: Krishna's universal form contains all universes, countless faces, forms, and celestial beings.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 11.12, what does Arjuna see in Krishna's cosmic form that terrifies him?
choices: All the warriors dying; the entire creation being consumed by his mouth
questions.feedback: Arjuna sees all the warriors on the battlefield entering Krishna's mouths and being consumed.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 11.14, what is Arjuna's reaction to seeing Krishna's cosmic form?
choices: Fear and awe; he becomes greatly disturbed and afraid
questions.feedback: Arjuna becomes terrified by the overwhelming nature of Krishna's universal form.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 11.18, how does Krishna describe His position in His cosmic form?
choices: I am time itself, the source of destruction of all worlds; I have come to engage you in war
questions.feedback: Krishna reveals Himself as time, the all-consuming force, and the source of all destruction.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 11.19-20, what does Krishna assure Arjuna about the warriors?
choices: They are already dead in My sight; you are only the instrument
questions.feedback: Krishna assures Arjuna that all the warriors are destined to die, and he is merely the instrument.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 11.31-34, what does Arjuna request after witnessing the cosmic form?
choices: Krishna to return to His beautiful form as Krishna the cowherd
questions.feedback: Arjuna feels reassured but requests Krishna to return to His attractive personal form.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 11.35-36, what does Krishna declare about His personal form?
choices: It is very difficult to see; only through unalloyed devotion can one understand My nature
questions.feedback: Krishna says His beautiful form is rarely seen; only pure devotion grants that vision.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 11.37, what does Arjuna admit about Krishna's nature?
choices: Krishna is worthy of all worship; he sees nothing superior to Krishna
questions.feedback: Arjuna admits that Krishna alone is worthy of all worship and is the supreme reality.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 11.39, what does Arjuna request to do as Krishna's servant?
choices: Fight against Duryodhana; he is willing to accomplish the task despite fear
questions.feedback: Arjuna declares his readiness to fight as Krishna's servant, overcoming his fear.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 11.40, what does Krishna say about knowledge of His cosmic form?
choices: It is very rare; only those with pure devotion can understand
questions.feedback: The knowledge of Krishna's transcendental nature is rarely understood except by pure devotees.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 11.44, what does Arjuna confess about his fear?
choices: Due to seeing the cosmic form, he is afraid and confused; his heart is trembling
questions.feedback: The awesome cosmic form temporarily overwhelms Arjuna with fear and confusion.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 11.45, what does Krishna do to console Arjuna?
choices: Resumes His original four-armed form to relieve Arjuna's fear
questions.feedback: Krishna returns to His gentle two-armed form to comfort and reassure Arjuna.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 11.47-48, how can one achieve the same abode as Krishna?
choices: Through exclusive devotion, meditating on Krishna's personal form in the heart
questions.feedback: Only through pure, exclusive devotion to Krishna can one reach His supreme abode.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 11.51 (purport), what is the significance of Krishna showing the cosmic form to Arjuna?
choices: To convince him of Krishna's supreme nature and remove his doubts
questions.feedback: The cosmic form vision establishes Krishna's absolute supremacy and removes all of Arjuna's hesitations.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 11.55 (purport), what is the highest form of understanding Krishna?
choices: Recognizing Krishna's loving personal form as the highest aspect of Godhead
questions.feedback: The personal loving form of Krishna is the highest manifestation of the Absolute Truth.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 11.53, what does Krishna emphasize about understanding Him?
choices: One must know Him as the Supreme Controller through love and devotion
questions.feedback: Understanding Krishna requires more than knowledge; it requires devotional service and love.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 11 (middle section), what does Arjuna see entering Krishna's mouths?
choices: All the demons and warriors, including Duryodhana's sons
questions.feedback: Arjuna sees the warriors and rulers of the opposing army entering Krishna's consuming mouths.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 11.33 (from purport), why does Arjuna want to see Krishna's personal form again?
choices: Because Krishna's personal form is more dear than the cosmic form
questions.feedback: The personal form of Krishna in His sweetness is more appealing than the awesome cosmic form.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 11.36 (from purport), how is Krishna's personal form achieved in the hearts of devotees?
choices: By exclusive devotion and engagement in Krishna's service
questions.feedback: Krishna's personal form is realized in the hearts of those who engage in pure devotional service.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 11 (from purport), what are the two features of Krishna shown?
choices: The infinite cosmic form and His sweet eternal personal form
questions.feedback: Chapter 11 reveals Krishna's both infinite cosmic nature and His sweet personal form.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 11.42 (from purport), how should one meditate on this vision?
choices: Gratefully, understanding Krishna's supremacy and one's own insignificance
questions.feedback: One should contemplate this vision with gratitude and humility toward Krishna.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 11.45 (from purport), why does Krishna return to His two-armed form?
choices: To establish a more intimate relationship of love with Arjuna
questions.feedback: Krishna returns to His personal form to restore intimate love and personal relationship with His devotee.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 11 (summary), what is the central message?
choices: Krishna's supreme nature is proven; loving devotion to His personal form is the path to the highest goal
questions.feedback: Chapter 11 reveals Krishna as the Supreme Truth and establishes that pure love for Him is supreme.
